channel.title: Items Disappear Upon Dropping?
channel.description: I know this is with the kind of source, but when you drop an item on my server, it disappears. How do I make it so it appears on the ground?

item.title: Items Disappear Upon Dropping?
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

Lol I totally forgot about this post Anyway!
I replaced it but I got this:

Also, that method will make it so I CAN see items on ground, correct?

Read full topic

Replace your current dropItem() method with that.

item.title: Items Disappear Upon Dropping?
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“Project Evolution, post:11, topic:340987”]You dont add that method, you uncomment the createGroundItem() method like so,

[code=java]public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot) {
// misc.printlnTag(“droppeditem [”+playerItems[slot]+"] which is
// ["+(droppedItem+1)+"]");
boolean a = true;
/* if (playerRights == 4) {
sM(“owner’s cannot drop items.”);
return ;
}*/
if (playerRights == 4) {
sM(“Admins cannot drop items.”);
return ;
}

if(playerName == null)
return;
if(droppedItem == 4708){
replaceitem2(4708, 4860);
}
if(droppedItem == 4710){
replaceitem2(4710, 4866);
}
if(droppedItem == 4712){
replaceitem2(4712, 4872);
}
if(droppedItem == 4714){
replaceitem2(4714, 4878);
}
if(droppedItem == 4716){
replaceitem2(4716, 4884);
}
if(droppedItem == 4718){
replaceitem2(4718, 4890);
}
if(droppedItem == 4720){
replaceitem2(4720, 4896);
}
if(droppedItem == 4722){
replaceitem2(4722, 4902);
}
if(droppedItem == 4724){
replaceitem2(4724, 4908);
}
if(droppedItem == 4726){
replaceitem2(4726, 4914);
}
if(droppedItem == 4728){
replaceitem2(4728, 4920);
}
if(droppedItem == 4730){
replaceitem2(4730, 4926);
}
if(droppedItem == 4732){
replaceitem2(4732, 4932);
}
if(droppedItem == 4734){
replaceitem2(4734, 4938);
}
if(droppedItem == 4736){
replaceitem2(4736, 4944);
}
if(droppedItem == 4738){
replaceitem2(4738, 4950);
}
if(droppedItem == 4745){
replaceitem2(4745, 4956);
}
if(droppedItem == 4747){
replaceitem2(4747, 4962);
}
if(droppedItem == 4749){
replaceitem2(4749, 4968);
}
if(droppedItem == 4751){
replaceitem2(4751, 4974);
}
if(droppedItem == 4753){
replaceitem2(4753, 4980);
}
if(droppedItem == 4755){
replaceitem2(4755, 4986);
}
if(droppedItem == 4757){
replaceitem2(4757, 4992);
}
if(droppedItem == 4759){
replaceitem2(4759, 4998);
}
if(droppedItem == 4045 && !isInJail()){
deleteItem(4045, 1);
dealDamage(15);
hitDiff = 15;
plrText = “Ouch!”;
plrTextUpdateRequired = true;
updateRequired = true;
hitUpdateRequired = true;
setAnimation(827);
return;
}
if ((playerItemsN[slot] != 0) && (droppedItem != -1)
&& (playerItems[slot] == droppedItem + 1)) {
for (int element : noTrade) {
}
if(destroyItem(droppedItem)) {
outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34);
outStream.writeWord(14171);
outStream.writeByte( 0);
outStream.writeWord(droppedItem + 1);
outStream.writeByte(255);
outStream.writeDWord(1);
outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
sendFrame126(“Are you sure you want to destroy this object?”, 14174);
sendFrame126(“Yes.”, 14175);
sendFrame126(“No.”, 141756);
sendFrame126(""+GetItemName(droppedItem), 14184);
sendFrame126(getMessageA(droppedItem),14182);
sendFrame126(getMessageB(droppedItem),14183);
sendFrame164(14170);
publicDroppendItem = droppedItem;
return;
}
createGroundItem(droppedItem, absX, absY, c);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
updateRequired = true;
savegame(false);
}
}
[/code]
Look at the change.[/quote]
So where would I add that (lol srry im so annoying. I’m a new coder and I’m barely understanding)

Read full topic

item.title: Items Disappear Upon Dropping?
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

You dont add that method, you uncomment the createGroundItem() method like so,

[code=java]public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot) {
// misc.printlnTag(“droppeditem [”+playerItems[slot]+"] which is
// ["+(droppedItem+1)+"]");
boolean a = true;
/* if (playerRights == 4) {
sM(“owner’s cannot drop items.”);
return ;
}*/
if (playerRights == 4) {
sM(“Admins cannot drop items.”);
return ;
}

if(playerName == null)
return;
if(droppedItem == 4708){
replaceitem2(4708, 4860);
}
if(droppedItem == 4710){
replaceitem2(4710, 4866);
}
if(droppedItem == 4712){
replaceitem2(4712, 4872);
}
if(droppedItem == 4714){
replaceitem2(4714, 4878);
}
if(droppedItem == 4716){
replaceitem2(4716, 4884);
}
if(droppedItem == 4718){
replaceitem2(4718, 4890);
}
if(droppedItem == 4720){
replaceitem2(4720, 4896);
}
if(droppedItem == 4722){
replaceitem2(4722, 4902);
}
if(droppedItem == 4724){
replaceitem2(4724, 4908);
}
if(droppedItem == 4726){
replaceitem2(4726, 4914);
}
if(droppedItem == 4728){
replaceitem2(4728, 4920);
}
if(droppedItem == 4730){
replaceitem2(4730, 4926);
}
if(droppedItem == 4732){
replaceitem2(4732, 4932);
}
if(droppedItem == 4734){
replaceitem2(4734, 4938);
}
if(droppedItem == 4736){
replaceitem2(4736, 4944);
}
if(droppedItem == 4738){
replaceitem2(4738, 4950);
}
if(droppedItem == 4745){
replaceitem2(4745, 4956);
}
if(droppedItem == 4747){
replaceitem2(4747, 4962);
}
if(droppedItem == 4749){
replaceitem2(4749, 4968);
}
if(droppedItem == 4751){
replaceitem2(4751, 4974);
}
if(droppedItem == 4753){
replaceitem2(4753, 4980);
}
if(droppedItem == 4755){
replaceitem2(4755, 4986);
}
if(droppedItem == 4757){
replaceitem2(4757, 4992);
}
if(droppedItem == 4759){
replaceitem2(4759, 4998);
}
if(droppedItem == 4045 && !isInJail()){
deleteItem(4045, 1);
dealDamage(15);
hitDiff = 15;
plrText = “Ouch!”;
plrTextUpdateRequired = true;
updateRequired = true;
hitUpdateRequired = true;
setAnimation(827);
return;
}
if ((playerItemsN[slot] != 0) && (droppedItem != -1)
&& (playerItems[slot] == droppedItem + 1)) {
for (int element : noTrade) {
}
if(destroyItem(droppedItem)) {
outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34);
outStream.writeWord(14171);
outStream.writeByte( 0);
outStream.writeWord(droppedItem + 1);
outStream.writeByte(255);
outStream.writeDWord(1);
outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
sendFrame126(“Are you sure you want to destroy this object?”, 14174);
sendFrame126(“Yes.”, 14175);
sendFrame126(“No.”, 141756);
sendFrame126(""+GetItemName(droppedItem), 14184);
sendFrame126(getMessageA(droppedItem),14182);
sendFrame126(getMessageB(droppedItem),14183);
sendFrame164(14170);
publicDroppendItem = droppedItem;
return;
}
createGroundItem(droppedItem, absX, absY, c);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
updateRequired = true;
savegame(false);
}
}
[/code]
Look at the change.

item.title: Items Disappear Upon Dropping?
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“Project Evolution, post:9, topic:340987”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=437382.msg3214188#msg3214188 date=1274555205]
No that’s the wrong method, you should have

ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[slot] - 1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[slot], playerId, false);
I believe
[/quote]

He means when he drops the item it disappears, in this case it is the commented-out createGroundItem() method.[/quote]

And how do I add that method :eek:

Read full topic

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:8, topic:340987”]No that’s the wrong method, you should have

ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[slot] - 1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[slot], playerId, false);
I believe[/quote]

He means when he drops the item it disappears, in this case it is the commented-out createGroundItem() method.

item.description:

No that’s the wrong method, you should have

item.title: Items Disappear Upon Dropping?
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“Project Evolution, post:6, topic:340987”]// createGroundItem(droppedItem, absX, absY, c);
There lies your problem. As you can see, the createGroundItem() was commented out which means its being ignored. This is stopping the item from being displayed on the ground. All you have to do is uncomment it (remove the //).[/quote]
So I just have to remove the 2 "/"s?

Read full topic

item.title: Items Disappear Upon Dropping?
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

// createGroundItem(droppedItem, absX, absY, c);

There lies your problem. As you can see, the createGroundItem() was commented out which means its being ignored. This is stopping the item from being displayed on the ground. All you have to do is uncomment it (remove the //).

Read full topic

item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

ytuio9:

client.java

I have no idea if this helps, but (If you havent noticed I’m a new coder):

[code] public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot) {
// misc.printlnTag(“droppeditem [”+playerItems[slot]+"] which is
// ["+(droppedItem+1)+"]");
boolean a = true;
/* if (playerRights == 4) {
sM(“owner’s cannot drop items.”);
return ;
}*/
if (playerRights == 4) {
sM(“Admins cannot drop items.”);
return ;
}

if(playerName == null)
return;
if(droppedItem == 4708){
replaceitem2(4708, 4860);
}
if(droppedItem == 4710){
replaceitem2(4710, 4866);
}
if(droppedItem == 4712){
replaceitem2(4712, 4872);
}

replaceitem2(4730, 4926);
}
if(droppedItem == 4732){
replaceitem2(4732, 4932);
}
if(droppedItem == 4734){
replaceitem2(4734, 4938);
}
if(droppedItem == 4736){
replaceitem2(4736, 4944);
}
if(droppedItem == 4738){
replaceitem2(4738, 4950);
}
if(droppedItem == 4745){
replaceitem2(4745, 4956);
}
if(droppedItem == 4747){
replaceitem2(4747, 4962);
}
if(droppedItem == 4749){
replaceitem2(4749, 4968);
}
if(droppedItem == 4751){
replaceitem2(4751, 4974);
}
if(droppedItem == 4753){
replaceitem2(4753, 4980);
}
if(droppedItem == 4755){
replaceitem2(4755, 4986);
}
if(droppedItem == 4757){
replaceitem2(4757, 4992);
}
if(droppedItem == 4759){
replaceitem2(4759, 4998);
}
if(droppedItem == 4045 && !isInJail()){
deleteItem(4045, 1);
dealDamage(15);
hitDiff = 15;
plrText = “Ouch!”;
plrTextUpdateRequired = true;
updateRequired = true;
hitUpdateRequired = true;
setAnimation(827);
return;
}
if ((playerItemsN[slot] != 0) && (droppedItem != -1)
&& (playerItems[slot] == droppedItem + 1)) {
for (int element : noTrade) {
}
if(destroyItem(droppedItem)) {
outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34);
outStream.writeWord(14171);
outStream.writeByte( 0);

// createGroundItem(droppedItem, absX, absY, c);

[/code]
